subject: Travel
title: Eating with Your Hands in India
description: A 60-second lesson on Eating with Your Hands in India.

hook.text: In India, eating with your hands isn't messy â€” it's the proper way to eat. Cutlery feels cold and distant.

buildup.text: Ayurvedic tradition says fingers connect you to the food and improve digestion through touch.

discovery.text: You eat only with the right hand. The left hand is reserved for personal hygiene and considered unclean.

twist.text: South Indians eat from banana leaves. When you're done, fold the leaf toward you to show you enjoyed it.

climax.text: Asking for a fork in a traditional Indian home can quietly offend the host. It implies the food is messy.

punchline.text: Sometimes the most elegant way to eat uses no utensils.

quiz.question: Why do Indians traditionally eat with the right hand only?
options: The left hand is considered unclean
